Definition: The input contains an argument and a keypoint on the topic "We should legalize cannabis", separated by "<sep>".Your task is to answer if the keypoint matches the argument and summarizes exactly what the argument means, in the context of this topic.

Positive Examples.input: Argument: It can be very beneficial for people with certain illnesses so should be legal<sep>Keypoint: Alcohol and tobacco are more harmful drugs yet remain legal
Positive Examples.explanation: The keypoint does not summarize the argument that it can be very beneficial for people with certain illnesses so should be legal

Positive Examples.input: Argument: We should legalize cannabis because it would cut down on crime and illegal dealings.<sep>Keypoint: Legalizing cannabis will reduce black-market/criminal activity
Positive Examples.explanation: The keypoint summarizes the argument that we should legalize cannabis because it would cut down on crime and illegal dealings.

Positive Examples.input: Argument: Legalizing marijuana would benefit the black market / drug cartels since the prices charged by state-licensed sellers can easily be undercut by cartels.<sep>Keypoint: Cannabis harms the body
Positive Examples.explanation: The keypoint does not summarize the argument that legalizing marijuana would benefit the black market / drug cartels since the prices charged by state-licensed sellers can easily be undercut by cartels.

Negative Examples.input: Argument: Cannabis should be legalized as it has been medically proved to be a beneficial pain management treatment for people who may not have direct access to a physician.<sep>Keypoint: Alcohol and tobacco are more harmful drugs yet remain legal
Negative Examples.explanation: The keypoint does not summarize the argument that cannabis should be legalized as it has been medically proved to be a beneficial pain management treatment for people who may not have direct access to a physician.

Negative Examples.input: Argument: Cannabis especially the skunk variety can be very harmful to people and can lead on to them using harder drugs so therefore it should be illegal.<sep>Keypoint: Cannabis harms the body
Negative Examples.explanation: The keypoint summarizes the argument that cannabis especially the skunk variety can be very harmful to people and can lead on to them using harder drugs so therefore it should be illegal.

Negative Examples.input: Argument: Legalizing cannabis would lead to more car accidents with people driving under the influence<sep>Keypoint: Cannabis increases lack-of-judgement/accidents
Negative Examples.explanation: The keypoint summarizes the argument that legalizing cannabis would lead to more car accidents with people driving under the influence
